required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between S-LAAO and Adverse Cardiovascular Events Among Patients Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting.
clinical_study.official_title: A Chinese Registry to Evaluate the Association of Surgical Left Atrial Appendage Occlusion vs No Receipt of S-LAAO With Adverse Cardiovascular Events Among Petients Undergoing Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting.

lead_sponsor.agency: Beijing Institute of Heart, Lung and Blood Vessel Diseases

clinical_study.source: Beijing Institute of Heart, Lung and Blood Vessel Diseases

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single-center, randomized, active controlled, clinical trail to assess the efficacy and safety of surgical closure of left atrial appendage (LAA) in patients undergoing coronary artery bypass graft.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 3 year after discharge (These data is collected during follow-up visit at in-hospital)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 year after discharge (These data is collected during follow-up visit at in-hospital)

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of ischemic stroke, thromboembolism and all death
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 3 year after discharge (These data is collected during follow-up visit at in-hospital)

intervention.description: CABG according to indications in the current guidelines on myocardial revascularization including surgical closure of left atrial appendage
